alert.note: Alert for Adams; Jefferson (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 03 at 4:27PM CST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Tensas and northern Concordia Parishes, southwestern Jefferson and northern Adams Counties through 530 PM CST... At 426 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near New Era, or 7 miles south of Monterey, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Monterey around 435 PM CST. Deer Park around 440 PM CST. Vidalia and Ferriday around 500 PM CST. Natchez around 505 PM CST. Spokane around 510 PM CST. Stanton around 520 PM CST. Church Hill around 525 PM CST. Other locations impacted by this storm include Ridgecrest. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 500 PM CST for southwestern Mississippi.
